commit_message:
Move shade into its own top-level team

shade started as a utility library for Infra, but has grown into a
popular and widely-used client library in its own right. However,
even though it's a solidly maintained library and is licensed
appropriately, it is not seen as an OpenStack deliverable.
While there is no rule that says that OpenStack must produce all of the
software it depends on, and in fact, OpenStack itself consumes a vast
amount of dependencies produced elsewhere, the fact that shade is
specifically focused on the OpenStack End User and the OpenStack APIs
makes it seem like it should be an official output of the OpenStack
project.

This is the first instance of moving a project from Infra to OpenStack,
so there are a few weirdnesses - notably shade publishes docs to
docs.openstack.org/infra not docs.openstack.org/developer and the shade
repo is in openstack-infra/shade not openstack/shade. We're not
suggesting changing the git repo due to it being unneccesary disruption.
The docs can be moved though, as it's easy to host a redirect.

Additionally, from shade's inception we've held that shade's existence
is a bug. However, as much fun as that is to say at conferences, perhaps
the time has come to put the negativity of that trope to rest and
instead focus on continuing to empower our users. It'll likely be a few
years yet before we could 'fix' all of the APIs to make shade unneeded
and even then we'll still have old clouds for a few more years that users
will still need to interact with. So as a general multi-cloud aware library
it'll likely be around for some time and should go ahead and be cared
for and fed.

While we're at it, move requestsexception over too. It was written for
and is used by shade, so having it be part of the same deliverable chain
is preferrable.

Change-Id: I7de2937bc18868c1c0c5c4dc2efbe3ede5865494
Signed-off-by: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/26/446426/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-21 16:36:38.000000000', 'files': ['tools/teamstats.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/295f7e581b3924aa5861db86b26c59042717d8dd', 'message': 'More gracefully handle intra-openstack moves

Splitting a project out into its own team causes problems with the

Change-Id: I68b1b7c4d98810f1d710351e4477fb83ef1fad21

commit_message:
More gracefully handle intra-openstack moves

Splitting a project out into its own team causes problems with the
diversity check if the new project is inside of another project. This is
because there is no {project}-group stackalytics container, only a
{{project}} one.

Trap for the 404 error and re-point to {{project}} if {{project}}-group
is not found.

Change-Id: I68b1b7c4d98810f1d710351e4477fb83ef1fad21
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/91/448191/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Just look for it without the group # suffix (e.g. during shade transition, there is no shade-group because # the shade repo was in infra-group) group = project.lower() commit_resp = s.get('http://stackalytics.com/api/' '1.0/stats/companies?metric=commits&release=all' '&project_type=all&module=%s&start_date=%s' % (group, six_months)) commits = commit_resp.json()

subject: [Newton-only] Enable services in the major-upgrade-pacemaker step
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-29 18:49:35.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_6.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/a7e6dcdb552fb93d84fbd06ba5bb3543ec3c1c62', 'message': '[Newton-only] Enable services in the major-upgrade-pacemaker step

During the "major-upgrade-pacemaker" step we basically do the following:
1) For all the OSP9-mitaka pacemaker services we first delete any
constraints and then disable and then delete the pacemaker resource from
the cluster CIB https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/newton/extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_migrations.sh#L67-L99
2) We then update all packages via yum
3) Then we start all the services.

In 3) we do this:
for service in $services; do
    manage_systemd_service start "${service%%-clone}"
    check_resource_systemd "${service%%-clone}" started 600
done

We also want to explicitly enable the service so that if a reboot
happens before the convergence step the controller node will come up
with the services being enabled.

Change-Id: Ie163e5f1d24b23b46092a9a3cb844fcb4e810f7b
Closes-Bug: #1677346
'}]
commit_message:
[Newton-only] Enable services in the major-upgrade-pacemaker step

During the "major-upgrade-pacemaker" step we basically do the following:
1) For all the OSP9-mitaka pacemaker services we first delete any
constraints and then disable and then delete the pacemaker resource from
the cluster CIB https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/newton/extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_migrations.sh#L67-L99
2) We then update all packages via yum
3) Then we start all the services.

In 3) we do this:
for service in $services; do
    manage_systemd_service start "${service%%-clone}"
    check_resource_systemd "${service%%-clone}" started 600
done

We also want to explicitly enable the service so that if a reboot
happens before the convergence step the controller node will come up
with the services being enabled.

Change-Id: Ie163e5f1d24b23b46092a9a3cb844fcb4e810f7b
Closes-Bug: #1677346
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/12/451512/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We add the enablement of the systemd services here because if a node gets rebooted # before the convergence step for whatever reason the migrated services will # not be enabled and we potentially have a bigger disruption. manage_systemd_service enable "${service%%-clone}"
deleted_lines: # FIXME: Should we let puppet during the convergence step do the service enabling or # should we add it here?

commit_message:
Run cluster check on nodes configured in wsrep_cluster_address.

Attempt to check galera's cluster status fails when galera service
is not running on the same node.

Change-Id: I27fb0841d85cd0dc86e92ac2e21eedf5f8f863ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/54/449154/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pcs resource show galera-master | grep wsrep_cluster_address | grep -q `hostname -s` RETVAL=$? if [[ $RETVAL == 0 ]]; then tstart=$(date +%s) while ! clustercheck; do sleep 5 tnow=$(date +%s) if (( tnow-tstart > galera_sync_timeout )) ; then echo "ERROR galera sync timed out" exit 1 fi done fi

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids. We should
use that function to generate uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: I9b6ba92d97c3f2d18b55752c1365184c5c342540

commit_message:
Do not attempt to load osinfo if we do not have os_distro

We get a warning logged every time we try to load up osinfo
with an image metadata that does not have the 'os_distro'
property set. We should be smarter and just not try to load
osinfo at all if we know we cannot get results.

Change-Id: I79ebea3ed222fb0db01d0a33c62a677d0381f66c
Closes-Bug: #1675602

commit_message:
Skip DHCP agent query in provisioning block setup

Provisioning blocks merged in Newton so for Pike we can
safely assume we are not running with Liberty agents that
don't notify the server when the port is ready.

This allows us to skip a query to the agents and configuration
parsing on every port provisioning block setup.

Related-Bug: #1453350
Change-Id: I8111469ad4b0d88580bff7a77492ad95af8e9377

It should be done as an another patch.

This is one of the patch divided from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404178/.
An another is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/451620/.

Change-Id: I59e734eec7af265531c6150caa7c9de6737dc6b5
Closes-Bug: #1637444
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Support security groups association per port

This patch support operation for operators and project users to
associate security groups to a port. The feature is mentioned at
the neutron user feedback session in Barcelona summit [1].

This function UI is same as the function of security groups
association per instance. To realize this, the way of implementation
for 'Edit port' is changed, which move from a single modal to a
workflow base.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ocata-neutron-end-user-operator-feedback (L.35+)

Also we need to display how security groups is associated at a port.
At the moment, there is not way to be able to see it (only this function).
It should be done as an another patch.

This is one of the patch divided from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404178/.
An another is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/451620/.

Change-Id: I59e734eec7af265531c6150caa7c9de6737dc6b5
Closes-Bug: #1637444
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove enable_api_gateway configuration option

1. What is the problem?
When central plugin and local plugin was first introduced, we add
a enable_api_gateway configuration option to ensure our code can
work with both local/central plugin and nova API gateway. Nova API
gateway has been moved out of tricircle for a long time, but the
configuration option is still there.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Remove enable_api_gateway configuration option

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
No new feature

Change-Id: Iac0204848fef9e8c5d70932a5e50f8b44409b725

commit_message:
Tolerate new SQLAlchemy==1.1.7

The following change in 1.1.x is causing failures.
http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/changelog/migration_11.html#specific-checks-added-for-passing-mapped-classes-instances-as-sql-literals

We should use "is" instead of "==" to check if the
model is the same as the class.

Change-Id: I212536e5fa587e13905b5f40976cd988af38c107

commit_message:
Remove revocation API dependency from identity API

The revocation API was listed as a dependency of the identity API,
but it was never used. If it was no longer being used, we shouldn't
make the identity API load it.

Change-Id: I8137b1e9f7058572c1cf8de2ead4d5b42212f098
partial-bug: 1671887

commit_message:
Update networking-guide-single-external-network

1. What is the problem?
The networking guide "North South Networking via Single
External Network" has not been described exactly to reflect
the practice deployment.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Update topology and description for where to deploy the
single external network, what happens if external
network and local network are located in same region.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
No new feature.

Change-Id: I16fe30af0b0f62404c48c20415321e7248b7d412
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/83/446883/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Only Neutron is required to be deployed in RegionThree if you want to make the external network being floating and applicable to all tenant's network. +-------------+ | RegionThree | | | | ext-net1 | | +----+----+ | | | | | +--+--+ | | | R1 | | | +-+---+ | | | | +-----+-------+ +-----------------+ | +-----------------+ | RegionOne | | | RegionTwo | | | bridge | net | | | ++-----------------+-----------------+-+ | | | | | | | | +--+--+ | | +-+---+ | | | R1 | | | | R1 | | | +--+--+ | | +--+--+ | | | net1 | | net2 | | | +---+--+-+ | | +-+--+---+ | | | | | | | | +---------+-+ | | +--+--------+ | | | Instance1 | | | | Instance2 | | | +-----------+ | | +-----------+ | +-----------------+ +-----------------+ Figure 1 North South Networking via Single External Network Please note if local network and external network are located in same region, router-interface-add will lead to one additional logic router for east-west networking. For example, in the following figure, external network ext-net1 is in RegionTwo, and if local network net2 is added router interface to the router R1, then the additional logical router R1 for east-west networking is created. .. code-block:: console what happened if router-interface-add R1 net2 Figure 2 What happened if local network and external network in same region Following commands are executed to create the Figure 1 topology. Different order to create this topology is also possible, for example, create router and tenant network first, then boot instance, set the router gateway, and associate floating IP as the last step. Create external network ext-net1, which will be located in RegionThree. $ neutron --os-region-name=CentralRegion net-create --provider:network_type vlan --provider:physical_network extern --router:external --availability-zone-hint RegionThree ext-net1 | availability_zone_hints | RegionThree |Continue to create network topology in RegionTwo. $ neutron --os-region-name=RegionThree floatingip-list
deleted_lines: The first step is to create the left topology, then enhance the topology to the right one. Different order to create this topology is also possible, for example, create router and tenant network first, then boot instance, set the router gateway, and associate floating IP as the last step. Create external network ext-net1, which will be located in RegionTwo. $ neutron --os-region-name=CentralRegion net-create --provider:network_type vlan --provider:physical_network extern --router:external --availability-zone-hint RegionTwo ext-net1 | availability_zone_hints | RegionTwo |Create network topology in RegionTwo. $ neutron --os-region-name=RegionTwo floatingip-list

commit_message:
osc-placement: an OSC plugin for Placement service

Create a new repo for the CLI for Placement service implemented as
a plugin for OSC. Imports a minimal coockiecutter template, that
implements the interface of OSC plugins. nova-core group should be
the initial core reviewers.

Blueprint: placement-osc-plugin

Needed-By: If996025a0bcce7bbc7a7fa9eb187df71dcfad32b
Change-Id: I545ae835d2d0fa52198b15ff006de11c319af236

Fix freezer client-* output

What's new:
* while running client-list and client-show, uuid is getting none
  modified the code to get correct uuid.

Change-Id: I629cdb1bb4bbabdd7e74b86f949cec44fb40e984

commit_message:
Fix $PROJECTS for Cinder LIO job

In the prior change [1] PROJECTS was updated for
the wrong job, which causes the dsvm-full-lio job
to fail.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/449799/

Change-Id: Iee8f4f3f7d946c1adfb71ed4e65cd3a14061b7b8

commit_message:
Don't pass argument sqlite_db in set_defaults()

Config option sqlite_db was removed from oslo.db[1].
And that isn't used in Masakari.
So we shouldn't set its default value.

Remarks:
Unit tests will be failed if this argument is passed in the latest
oslo.db.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/commit/cc64f7010522e812a696159009a72e59e2b017a8

Change-Id: I9ae18b905eddb5441b96e0209efc35a98cfbaa4c
Closes-Bug: #1677138

commit_message:
Fix unittest run on s390x host

Explicitely mention a supported architecture when doing factory
tests, otherwise instantiation fails on hosts that do not support
them

Change-Id: Icccd955a27c8606b520f4426205d5489fc1c736d

commit_message:
Add placement api ref jenkins job

Nova has subproject called Placement API. It will be separated
openstack project in the future but until some moment it's in Nova.
Placement API has its own api-ref run by `tox -e placement-api-ref`.

This change adds new jenkins job gate-placement-api-ref-nv run for Nova
project only. It uploads built api-ref to separate folder on docs-draft.

When Placement API has separate code base this changes should be reverted.

Change-Id: I891a2512efe067f3f45a24cc4ff19460a568046e

commit_message:
Test pyeclib against libec master

Currently pyeclib tests against the packaged version
of liberasurecode. This jenkins job adds the ability to
build libec master and run the pyeclib tests.

Change-Id: If73416334bb5a54e237dc6fe74f612053ea2046d
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Barbican grenade gate

Add a gate to run Barbican's grenade plugin.

Co-Author-By: Nam Nguyen Hoai <namnh@vn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Remove usage of os-cloud-config

Since we don't need os-cloud-config anymore to perform the Keystone
resources management, let's remove the workaround we had to handle back
in Mitaka and before.

Also remove the installation of os-cloud-config.

Change-Id: I0bf8c17aabf646e5206f579cd20e3910aae61da3
Related-Bug: #1677008
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/39/450939/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Extend testing for GenerateFencingParamatersAction.

We now test that unprovisioned Ironic nodes are ignored by the fencing
parameters generator.

This commit adds testing for a bug fixed in
  c4b04bbd6ac2a8a4d3bb7ece4f8a0b4cecdd020c

Change-Id: Ie55e44657c90e2fd1cf3bfed4dcb3fd932f5eadf
Related-Bug: #1671881

commit_message:
Include nova::compute::libvirt::qemu from the libvirt profile

This is useful to customize the libvirt/qemu.conf limits when deploying
a large overcloud or one with many Ceph OSDs.

Change-Id: I258afd3ee6633e4b2ebc45aa8611be652476be0c
Depends-On: I5fa423a4b212d14f6e9ff6a270931b569558b54e
(cherry picked from commit a6b6c0568daa289b179a0f0aeead2eb83a1a0743)
Partial-Bug: 1673995

commit_message:
Adds service for managing securetty

This adds the ability to manage the securetty file.

By allowing management of securetty, operators can limit root
console access and improve security through hardening.

Change-Id: Ic4647fb823bd112648c5b8d102913baa8b4dac1c
Closes-Bug: #1665042

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # require 'spec_helper' describe 'tripleo::profile::base::securetty' do shared_examples_for 'tripleo::profile::base::securetty' do context 'with securtty configured' do let(:params) {{ :ttty_list => ['console', 'tty1', 'tty2', 'tty3, tty4, tty5, tty6] }} it 'should configure securetty' do is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/securetty').with({ .with_content(/console/) .with_content(/tty1/) .with_content(/tty2/) .with_content(/tty3/) .with_content(/tty4/) .with_content(/tty5/) .with_content(/tty6/) 'owner' => 'root', 'group' => 'root', 'mode' => '0600', }) end end end end

commit_message:
Add support for exec resize

This endpoint will be used by cleint to resize the tty session
of exec.

Partial-Implements: blueprint support-interactive-mode
Change-Id: Ied3b90295c75a32f8543a4e92481a01c22b870df

commit_message:
Update doc and add release note for vxlan

1. What is the problem?
The spec and implementaion of vxlan network support have been
submitted, but we lack updating related documents and adding
a release note.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Update related documents and add a release note.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
N/A

Change-Id: I392022226b06e75f7813befc78927cb5779e0a45

commit_message:
Support interactive mode in exec API

Add a parameter "interactive" to exec endpoint. If this parameter
is true, Zun will open the stdin and allocate a pseudo-TTY when
creating the exec instance. As a result, users can execute commands
interactively.

Partially-Implements: blueprint support-interactive-mode
Change-Id: Ibc55a20bcca5a8534330c19f735548801e2fc33a

added_lines: def execute(self, container_id, run=True, interactive=False, **kw): interactive = strutils.bool_from_string(interactive, strict=True) run, interactive)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary setUp function in testcase

In testcase, setUp will be called automatically. This patch used to
remove setUp functions that do nothing. Besides, it will keep code clean.

Change-Id: I6082c3dcead3e302cfcf47d37fa87e1984dda4a1

subject: Add version string to status string
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-27 19:50:43.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/tests/test_api.py', 'openstack_health/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health/commit/769f9d3cd76c343fda337f60a293659af607d582', 'message': 'Add version string to status string

Sometimes debugging puppet deployment issues is difficult without
knowing exactly which version of the code is actually running. To help
debug automated deployment issues being able to query the exact version
running is useful. This commit does this by adding the version string to
the /status response so we can easily tell which version is running.

Change-Id: I4a26cf097cd1efc9962911e7b5824eb6b8b2f5d9
'}]
commit_message:
Add version string to status string

Sometimes debugging puppet deployment issues is difficult without
knowing exactly which version of the code is actually running. To help
debug automated deployment issues being able to query the exact version
running is useful. This commit does this by adding the version string to
the /status response so we can easily tell which version is running.

Change-Id: I4a26cf097cd1efc9962911e7b5824eb6b8b2f5d9

Use reader and writer for db operations.

Partially-Implements blueprint: enginefacade-switch

commit_message:
Change metadata to align with team affiliation

Shade is its own team now, update "author" to be OpenStack.

Note, the homepage setting does not exist until we tag a release after
the depends-on project-config patch lands. But this metadata also will
not go to PyPI until we tag a release - thus the depends-on.

Depends-On: Id3a087a41491eb8bf8eb51a0247183c6b91a297a
Change-Id: I4fc7ed2ecca0d218be7f1e1e34dcfa4c4b623d4e

Change-Id: I1f00242b49c7646421390c0ff26777aba6d5b6d9
Closes-Bug: #1654035

commit_message:
Do not check spacing if periodic disabled

This change allows simple enable/disable periodic and set spacing
via one configuration option, like
@periodics.periodic(spacing=CONF.task_interval,
                    enabled=CONF.task_interval > 0)

Change-Id: I1f00242b49c7646421390c0ff26777aba6d5b6d9
Closes-Bug: #1654035
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/futurist refs/changes/23/449123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_interval_checking(self): @periodics.periodic(-0.5, enabled=False) def no_add_me(): pass w = periodics.PeriodicWorker([], **self.worker_kwargs) self.assertEqual(0, len(w)) self.assertIsNone(w.add(no_add_me)) self.assertEqual(0, len(w)) self.assertRaises(ValueError, periodics.periodic, -0.5)

subject: Shared VxLAN (Part5: bulk create shadow port)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 06:27:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/48e6c34c8459fd4e57b640f34c8a411e0dc4432e', 'message': "Shared VxLAN (Part5: bluk create shadow port)

1. What is the problem?
VLAN network has some restrictions that VxLAN network doesn't have.
For more flexible networking deployment, we consider supporting
cross-pod VxLAN network.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
We are going to use shadow agent/port mechanism to synchronize VTEP
information and make cross-pod VxLAN networking available, as discussed
in the specification document[1].

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
This is the fifth patch for cross-pod VxLAN networking support, which
introduces the following changes:

(1) Use bluk API to create shadow ports
(2) Do not create resource routing entries for shadow ports

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/429155/

Change-Id: I8b2dc98d84385433727e55584c80e1054fce406f

commit_message:
Shared VxLAN (Part5: bulk create shadow port)

1. What is the problem?
VLAN network has some restrictions that VxLAN network doesn't have.
For more flexible networking deployment, we consider supporting
cross-pod VxLAN network.

We are going to use shadow agent/port mechanism to synchronize VTEP
information and make cross-pod VxLAN networking available, as discussed
in the specification document[1].

In the previous implementation, we use a loop to create shadow ports
one by one. When there are large numbers of shadow ports need to be
created, the large numbers of API requests will affect the performance.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Use bulk creation API to create shadow port.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
This is the fifth patch for cross-pod VxLAN networking support, which
introduces the following changes:

(1) Use bulk API to create shadow ports
(2) Do not create resource routing entries for shadow ports

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/429155/

Change-Id: I8b2dc98d84385433727e55584c80e1054fce406f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/12/444112/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # since we don't create resource routing entries for shadow # ports, we traverse pods network is located to delete ports for pod, _id in self.helper.get_real_shadow_resource_iterator( t_ctx, t_constants.RT_NETWORK, port['network_id']): self.xjob_handler.delete_server_port(t_ctx, port_id, def _delete_shadow_bridge_port(self, t_ctx, bridge_port): mappings = db_api.get_bottom_mappings_by_top_id( t_ctx, bridge_port['network_id'], t_constants.RT_NETWORK) for pod, _id in mappings: self._get_client(region_name).delete_ports(t_ctx, bridge_port['id']) t_ns_port = bridge_ports[0] t_ns_port_id = t_ns_port['id'] self._delete_shadow_bridge_port(t_ctx, t_ns_port)
deleted_lines: for pod, bottom_port_id in ( self.helper.get_real_shadow_resource_iterator( t_ctx, t_constants.RT_PORT, port_id)): self.xjob_handler.delete_server_port(t_ctx, bottom_port_id, def _delete_shadow_bridge_port(self, t_ctx, bridge_port_id): mappings = db_api.get_bottom_mappings_by_top_id(t_ctx, bridge_port_id, t_constants.RT_SD_PORT) for pod, b_port_id in mappings: self._get_client(region_name).delete_ports(t_ctx, b_port_id) with t_ctx.session.begin(): core.delete_resources( t_ctx, models.ResourceRouting, filters=[{'key': 'top_id', 'comparator': 'eq', 'value': bridge_port_id}, {'key': 'pod_id', 'comparator': 'eq', 'value': pod['pod_id']}]) t_ns_port_id = bridge_ports[0]['id'] self._delete_shadow_bridge_port(t_ctx, t_ns_port_id)

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertEqual(False, A, m), assertEqual(True, A, m) and
assertEqual(None, A, m) use assertFalse(A, m), assertTrue(A, m)
and assertIsNone(A, m)

Change-Id: I0423d9c565103e997d93a15e766472b8bc34ba0c

devstack: install python-dracclient if DRAC enabled

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/26/425326/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Closes-Bug: #1674577

Change-Id: I7553ae7c222f61b6796b72ac4a2b744d3e08fee6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/69/447869/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.exception("'eventlet' is required for " "TpoolDbapiWrapper.")
deleted_lines: from oslo_db._i18n import _LE LOG.exception(_LE("'eventlet' is required for " "TpoolDbapiWrapper."))

commit_message:
Remove revocation API dependency from resource API

The revocation API was listed as a dependency of the resource API,
but it was never used. If it was no longer being used, we shouldn't
make the resource API load it.

Change-Id: Ia70064dce20a0bebf7b31a6b895ea0e5a0248480
partial-bug: 1671887

commit_message:
Remove set_mac_address from old remote_client

set_mac_address() was called from test_network_basic_ops only and
it is not necessary to keep it as common method in Tempest.
Then this patch moves the implementation into test_network_basic_ops
and removes set_mac_address() from old remote_client.
In addition, this patch merges 3 exec_command() calls into a single
call for avoiding ssh re-connections.

Change-Id: I60b86a143e3987b911fa070754879bd002128120
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/42/448742/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cmd = ("sudo ip link set {nic} down;" "sudo ip link set dev {nic} address {mac};" "sudo ip link set {nic} up").format(nic=spoof_nic, mac=spoof_mac) ssh_client.exec_command(cmd)

commit_message:
Add requirements gate jobs to shade and requestsexceptions

Shade is an OpenStack project now, so should be tracking
global-requirements. This depends on the patches to add jmespath and
munch to global-requirements so that shade isn't left unable to land
patches. Also, remove infra-publish jobs from requestexceptions - they
were not used anyway.

Change-Id: I334c4870e6bb608682573e69fff727264462a1e1
Depends-On: I963a558f5e294521ad7b067ae95cc02d379cf73b

commit_message:
Allow debugging libvirtd with electric fence

Change-Id: I54a9421e4b614a77d16eefdd9167287e216ae17f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/30/451430/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function systemd_service_enable_coredump { local service=$1 local electricfence_pkg=$2 # Check we're running systemd if [ ! -x `which systemctl` -o \ $(systemctl is-system-running) == "offline" ]; then echo "*** WARNING: ${service} coredumps not configured" return fi install_package ${electricfence_pkg} confdir=/etc/systemd/system/${service}.service.d sudo mkdir -p ${confdir} conffile=${confdir}/coredump.conf sudo tee ${conffile} <<EOF [Service] LimitCORE=infinity Environment="LD_PRELOAD=libefence.so.0.0" Environment="EF_ALLOW_MALLOC_0=1" EOF # Tell systemd to reload the unit sudo systemctl daemon-reload # Restart the service if it's already running sudo systemctl try-restart ${service}.service } local libvirt_service libvirt_service=libvirt-bin electricfence_pkg=electric-fence libvirt_service=libvirtd electricfence_pkg=ElectricFence fi if [[ $DEBUG_LIBVIRT_COREDUMPS == True ]]; then # Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1643911 # Create a coredump directory, and instruct the kernel to save to here sudo mkdir -p /var/core sudo chmod a+wrx /var/core echo '/var/core/core.%e.%p.%h.%t' | \ sudo tee /proc/sys/kernel/core_pattern systemd_service_enable_coredump ${libvirt_service} ${electricfence_pkg}
deleted_lines: if [[ $DEBUG_LIBVIRT_COREDUMPS == True ]]; then # Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1643911 # This is fairly specific to our Xenial hosts. # Unfortunately between plain initscripts, systemd, # apport, systemd-coredump, abrt, ... there is no shortage # of different ways to inspire the system to keep a # coredump. This is a KISS approach to get some # backtraces we can copy out into logs. local f=/lib/systemd/system/libvirt-bin.service if [ -f $f ]; then # set the ulimit in libvirt service file and reload # config iniset -sudo $f "Service" "LimitCORE" "infinity" sudo systemctl daemon-reload # make sure it's widely writable sudo mkdir /var/core sudo chmod a+wrx /var/core # instruct the kernel to save to here echo '/var/core/core.%e.%p.%h.%t' | \ sudo tee /proc/sys/kernel/core_pattern # restart for good measure sudo /etc/init.d/libvirt-bin restart else # not systemd?? echo "*** WARNING: libvirt coredumps not configured" fi fi

commit_message:
This fixes the check class stop() interface so it allows subclass check to override the default
behavior and adds the stop implementation in vcenter check so it logs out from vcenter session
when the collector is stopped.

Change-Id: I83fac9995dbeabfa082cc241a1ee3f7940032ed6

commit_message:
Revert "[install-guide] Workaround step for Dashboard"

This reverts commit 5d7e6cd9e7be8e70744576af749cb454965f7c93.

This patch isn't really needed; we have a warning in Horizon
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/443716/) which has been proposed for
backport to stable. This is just a bug in the Ubuntu packages, and docs
shouldn't be expected to carry a workaround for a bug which already
logs a warning.

Change-Id: I3888a7cd671394d67d388106defb2358389f13e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/20/451320/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. only:: ubuntu 3. Due to a package bug, change the ownership and user permissions for Dashboard and the ``secret_key`` directory: .. code-block:: console # chown www-data:www-data /var/lib/openstack-dashboard # chown www-data:www-data /var/lib/openstack-dashboard/secret_key # chmod 700 /var/lib/openstack-dashboard # chmod 600 /var/lib/openstack-dashboard/secret_key .. endonly

subject: Replace wip with skip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-28 21:18:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/5cdaa962818e5e7e12343b28e4f878b80725e3cb', 'message': "Replace wip with skip

We were using wip to ignore a test failure when we really

commit_message:
Replace wip with skip

We were using wip to ignore a test failure when we really
just don't want the test run. wip is specifically for cases
where work needs to be done to make a test pass.

Change-Id: I5d827fef2ed2db7fcd44837b32179e0801a476ef

commit_message:
Removed domain conflict guard in load_fixtures

Removed the guard around domain so that it matches the other types
of data being loaded. This also ensures we are not doing more work
than we need to during test setup.

Change-Id: Iaeda73103277b1f05bb1797679f1a596710d4a79

commit_message:
Add group_members_are_ids to whitelisted options

This patch addresses a bug and adds group_members_are_ids to the
whitelist to allow for use in `keystone-manage domain_config_upload`

Change-Id: Ifa8d0d723e90be16888859bfa2b0804a0b183877
Closes-Bug: 1670382

commit_message:
Fix some reST field lists in docstrings

Probably the most common format for documenting arguments is reST field
lists [1]. This change updates some docstrings to comply with the field
lists syntax.

[1] http://sphinx-doc.org/domains.html#info-field-lists

Change-Id: Ie48819bc460680fac8c9d0971a8183ed96d4d981

commit_message:
Extend CI for monasca-agent

Following commit does several things:

* changes nose to ostestr
* enables coverage
* adds flake8 for tests
* adds bandit

Bandit note:
Multiple asserts of bandit had to be disabled at this
point because fixing them was not obvious. Several simple
asserts like B110 [try_except_pass] were fixed with

Closes-Bug: #1628740
Change-Id: I640857349008178e8a6f565e31ca2fde26ce8da7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/93/379093/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:cover] commands = nosetests -w tests/ -e tests_to_fix --with-coverage \ --cover-package=monasca_agent --cover-erase coverage html --include 'monasca_agent/*' --omit '*/tests/*'

commit_message:
Remove unused revoke_by_domain_role_assignment

This patch removes a method that wasn't being used anymore anywhere
except for a single unit test. In addition, we no longer need to store
the revocation event when the token provider API will rebuild the
token context at validation time. Some of the test coverage for this
behavior can be located here:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_assignment.py#L1175-L1177
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_assignment.py#L1191-L1193
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_assignment.py#L1311

Change-Id: I1ee53f15ec6b2dae10bfbd0fc3435e018f26f04b
partial-bug: 1671887

commit_message:
Remove unused revoke_by_project_role_assignment

This patch removes a method that wasn't being used anymore anywhere
except for a single unit test. In addition, we no longer need to store
the revocation event when the token provider API will rebuild the
token context at validation time, and this revocation method isn't being
exposed to an external API.

Among some of the test coverage for this can be found here:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py#L2030-L2060

Change-Id: Ie92b238b0968a23bca3f0f57879369ea74298b8d
partial-bug: 1671887

subject: Doc db_sync --expand incurring downtime in upgrades to Newton
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-28 15:44:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/upgrading.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/e6ef702f22929de831f07e6f56d7b696dfa50b89', 'message': "Doc db_sync --expand incurring downtime in upgrades to Newton

The current implementation of db_sync --expand automatically runs any
outstanding legacy operations to ensure it's safety. However, that
behavior also means that legacy migrations may violate the safety
assumptions around --expand.

This is only true for Mitaka to Newton upgrades, as there should not be
any newer migrations in the legacy repository to be triggered by this
behavior.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/0ebd557325ff16c2535dac0eb190792e6d511a79/keystone/common/sql/upgrades.py#L269-L271

Change-Id: Ib175f7fce96011d77eb4783123cb2d265d60aa42
Closes-Bug: 1676925
"}]
commit_message:
Doc db_sync --expand incurring downtime in upgrades to Newton

The current implementation of db_sync --expand automatically runs any
outstanding legacy operations to ensure it's safety. However, that
behavior also means that legacy migrations may violate the safety
assumptions around --expand.

This is only true for Mitaka to Newton upgrades, as there should not be
any newer migrations in the legacy repository to be triggered by this
behavior.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/0ebd557325ff16c2535dac0eb190792e6d511a79/keystone/common/sql/upgrades.py#L269-L271

Change-Id: Ib175f7fce96011d77eb4783123cb2d265d60aa42
Closes-Bug: 1676925
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/63/450863/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. NOTE: Upgrading without downtime is only supported in deployments upgrading *from* Newton or a newer release. If upgrading a Mitaka deployment to Newton, the commands described here will be available as described below, but the ``keystone-manage db_sync --expand`` command will incur downtime (similar to running ``keystone-manage db_sync``), as it runs legacy (downtime-incurring) migrations prior to running schema expansions. #. (*New in Newton*) Run ``keystone-manage db_sync --expand`` on the first node to expand the database schema to a superset of what both the previous and next release can utilize, and create triggers to facilitate the live migration process.#. (*New in Newton*) Run ``keystone-manage db_sync --migrate`` on the first node to forcefully perform data migrations. This process will migrate all data from the old schema to the new schema while the previous release continues to operate normally.#. (*New in Newton*) Run ``keystone-manage db_sync --contract`` to remove the old schema and all data migration triggers.
deleted_lines: #. Run ``keystone-manage db_sync --expand`` on the first node to expand the database schema to a superset of what both the previous and next release can utilize, and create triggers to facilitate the live migration process.#. Run ``keystone-manage db_sync --migrate`` on the first node to forcefully perform data migrations. This process will migrate all data from the old schema to the new schema while the previous release continues to operate normally.#. Run ``keystone-manage db_sync --contract`` to remove the old schema and all data migration triggers.

commit_message:
Move domain policies to DocumentedRuleDefault

A new policy class was introduce that requires
additional parameters when defining policy objects.

This patch switches our domain policy object to
the policy.DocumentedRuleDefault and fills the
required policy parameters as needed.


Change-Id: Ie54930081ad7761c4b7dd3d3b0eb3bb5e4c23827
Partially-Implements: bp policy-docs

commit_message:
Allow to configure policy.json for OpenStack projects

For both containers and classic deployments, allow to configure
policy.json for all OpenStack APIs with new parameters (hash,
empty by default).

Example of new parameter: NovaApiPolicies.
See environments/nova-api-policy.yaml for how the feature can be used.

Note: use it with extreme caution.

Partial-implement: blueprint modify-policy-json
Change-Id: I1144f339da3836c3e8c8ae4e5567afc4d1a83e95

commit_message:
undercloud-setup: Add default variable for toci_vxlan_networking

This commit adds a default variable for toci_vxlan_networking that is
used by the vxlan networking tasks in the undercloud-setup role to
determine when to set up vxlan networking. the value has been replaced
by 'vxlan_networking', although that change has not landed in tripleo-ci
with review 477142 yet.

Change-Id: I63ecc8f2c27cd32c909ed797efe91da2ff93c2cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/21/451521/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: toci_vxlan_networking: false

commit_message:
Move endpoint policies to DocumentedRuleDefault

A new policy class was introduce that requires
additional parameters when defining policy objects.

This patch switches our endpoint policy object to
the policy.DocumentedRuleDefault and fills the
required policy parameters as needed.

Change-Id: If4807db929cc603354650b53e9e86114d225130b
Partially-Implements: bp policy-docs

commit_message:
Support multiple messages from introspect workflow

This updates the workflow wrapper to use the multiple message interface.

Change-Id: I065652693a1c15e8cad9a06f715a0d5306ff828f
Partial-Bug: #1646887

subject: Nic config mappings for deployed-server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-28 11:45:11.000000000', 'files': ['environments/deployed-server-environment.j2.yaml', 'environments/deployed-server-environment.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/c41f483676ce17a9a6b3421c7b0ecd1b4dc3b27c', 'message': 'Nic config mappings for deployed-server

Adds default nic config mappings when using the deployed-server custom
roles data at deployed-server/deployed-server-roles-data.yaml.
Previously there were no default mappings as the hardcoded mapping for
the Controller role from overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml
would not be used since there is no Controller role when using
deployed-server.

The default mapping is net-config-static.yaml instead of
net-config-noop.yaml, since there is no requirement of a L2 domain for
dhcp between undercloud and overcloud nodes when using deployed-server.

The convenience mapping of ControllerDeployedServer to
net-config-static-bridge.yaml is also added so that out of the box the
roles with controller services will get the right bridge created.

The mappings can always be overridden in later environment files if
needed.

Change-Id: I581fec99b459a12512686e47b10b962756652eb3
Closes-Bug: #1670493

(cherry picked from commit cdbf1ca1918af649d1079ee07a9303059c9723ed)
'}]
commit_message:
Nic config mappings for deployed-server

Adds default nic config mappings when using the deployed-server custom
roles data at deployed-server/deployed-server-roles-data.yaml.
Previously there were no default mappings as the hardcoded mapping for
the Controller role from overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml
would not be used since there is no Controller role when using
deployed-server.

The default mapping is net-config-static.yaml instead of
net-config-noop.yaml, since there is no requirement of a L2 domain for
dhcp between undercloud and overcloud nodes when using deployed-server.

The convenience mapping of ControllerDeployedServer to
net-config-static-bridge.yaml is also added so that out of the box the
roles with controller services will get the right bridge created.

The mappings can always be overridden in later environment files if
needed.

Change-Id: I581fec99b459a12512686e47b10b962756652eb3
Closes-Bug: #1670493
Depends-On: Ib681729cc2728ca4b0486c14166b6b702edfcaab
(cherry picked from commit cdbf1ca1918af649d1079ee07a9303059c9723ed)

subject: Fix "pretend_min_part_hours" for MR swift tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-29 14:45:25.000000000', 'files': ['tests/os_swift-overrides-MR-B.yml', 'tests/os_swift-overrides-MR-A.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift/commit/c578ebfde0770cdb80b89255994abd09bc7f3ad8', 'message': 'Fix "pretend_min_part_hours" for MR swift tests

When running a MR swift deploy we rebalance the ring in quick
succession.

To do this successfully we need to set the
"swift_pretend_min_part_hours_passed" to True. This shouldn't be needed
in a regular deploy, or a deploy where rings don't change.

Change-Id: Ib86dcfbdb5f6346e2c7da67b6bf2b29c62f99dab
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "pretend_min_part_hours" for MR swift tests

When running a MR swift deploy we rebalance the ring in quick
succession.

To do this successfully we need to set the
"swift_pretend_min_part_hours_passed" to True. This shouldn't be needed
in a regular deploy, or a deploy where rings don't change.

Change-Id: Ib86dcfbdb5f6346e2c7da67b6bf2b29c62f99dab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/44/451444/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: swift_pretend_min_part_hours_passed: True

subject: Add multi-region configuration in gate_hook.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-27 09:15:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/113dc40b65cedaf9c8f1d4f1fc51b5e11b82592b', 'message': 'Add multi-region configuration in pre_test_hook.sh

1. What is the problem
Currently the function test job in Tricircle can only
work in single region, and most of multi-region test cases
are not able to be tested without multi-region test
environment.

2. What is the solution for the problem
Add multi-node gate job, and configure the subnode to the second
region, and use the keystone in the primary node, so that
multi-region gate/check test environment could be established
for Tricircle

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
No feature delivered to end user, just enable multi-region test.

Change-Id: I9f3d50b4fcf7796f39d3342d9a044d359f4fd7e9
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Add multi-region configuration in gate_hook.sh

1. What is the problem
Currently the function test job in Tricircle can only
work in single region, and most of multi-region test cases
are not able to be tested without multi-region test
environment.

2. What is the solution for the problem
Add multi-node gate job, and configure the subnode to the second
region, and use the keystone in the primary node, so that
multi-region gate/check test environment could be established
for Tricircle

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
No feature delivered to end user, just enable multi-region test.

Change-Id: I9f3d50b4fcf7796f39d3342d9a044d359f4fd7e9
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

added_lines: set -ex GATE_DEST=$BASE/new DEVSTACK_PATH=$GATE_DEST/devstack export localconf=$DEVSTACK_PATH/local.conf function _setup_tricircle_multinode { PRIMARY_NODE_IP=$(cat /etc/nodepool/primary_node_private) SUBNODE_IP=$(head -n1 /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private) export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG="enable_plugin tricircle https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tricircle/" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+="$DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG TRICIRCLE_START_SERVICES=True REGION_NAME=RegionOne HOST_IP=$PRIMARY_NODE_IP " export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG="enable_plugin tricircle https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tricircle/" export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+="$DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG TRICIRCLE_START_SERVICES=False REGION_NAME=RegionTwo HOST_IP=$SUBNODE_IP SERVICE_HOST=$HOST_IP KEYSTONE_REGION_NAME=RegionOne KEYSTONE_SERVICE_HOST=$PRIMARY_NODE_IP KEYSTONE_AUTH_HOST=$PRIMARY_NODE_IP " } if [ "$DEVSTACK_GATE_TOPOLOGY" == "multinode" ]; then _setup_tricircle_multinode fi

1. What is the problem?
VLAN network has some restrictions that VxLAN network doesn't have.
For more flexible networking deployment, we consider supporting
cross-pod VxLAN network.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
We are going to use shadow agent/port mechanism to synchronize VTEP
information and make cross-pod VxLAN networking available, as discussed
in the specification document[1].

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
This is the forth patch for cross-pod VxLAN networking support, which
introduces the following changes:

(1) Make bridge network gateway port creation also trigger shadow
agent and shadow port setup, so we can use VxLAN type bridge network
(2) Delete shadow bridge ports when clearing bridge network/subnet

commit_message:
Shared VxLAN (Part4: bridge network l3)

1. What is the problem?
VLAN network has some restrictions that VxLAN network doesn't have.
For more flexible networking deployment, we consider supporting
cross-pod VxLAN network.

We are going to use shadow agent/port mechanism to synchronize VTEP
information and make cross-pod VxLAN networking available, as discussed
in the specification document[1].

With the previous parts[2, 3, 4], VxLAN network already works for
tenant network, but bridge network still lacks VxLAN network support.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
We need to build VxLAN tunnels for bridge ports, so bridge port
creation should also trigger shadow agent and shadow port setup.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
This is the forth patch for cross-pod VxLAN networking support, which
introduces the following changes:

(1) Make bridge network gateway port creation also trigger shadow
agent and shadow port setup, so we can use VxLAN type bridge network
(2) Delete shadow bridge ports when clearing bridge network/subnet

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/429155/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425128/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425129/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425130/

Change-Id: I3f3054c9300566ddbdd5b6d523f547485462447c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/31/425131/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @staticmethod def _create_mapping_for_vm_port(t_ctx, port_body, pod): entries = [(ip['subnet_id'], t_constants.RT_SUBNET) for ip in port_body['fixed_ips']] entries.append((port_body['network_id'], t_constants.RT_NETWORK)) entries.append((port_body['id'], t_constants.RT_PORT)) if port_body['security_groups']: for sg_id in port_body['security_groups']: entries.append((sg_id, t_constants.RT_SG)) for resource_id, resource_type in entries: if db_api.get_bottom_id_by_top_id_region_name( t_ctx, resource_id, pod['region_name'], resource_type): continue db_api.create_resource_mapping(t_ctx, resource_id, resource_id, pod['pod_id'], port_body['tenant_id'], resource_type) def _trigger_xjob_for_vm_port(self, context, port_body, pod): interfaces = super(TricirclePlugin, self).get_ports( context, {'network_id': [port_body['network_id']], 'device_owner': [constants.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF]}) interfaces = [inf for inf in interfaces if inf['device_id']] if interfaces: # request may be come from service, we use an admin context # to run the xjob admin_context = t_context.get_admin_context() self.xjob_handler.setup_bottom_router( admin_context, port_body['network_id'], interfaces[0]['device_id'], pod['pod_id']) else: LOG.debug('Update port: no interfaces found, xjob not' 'triggered') device_name = profile_dict[t_constants.PROFILE_DEVICE] if device_name.startswith('compute:'): # local plugin will also update region information for bridge # gateway port, but we only need to create resource routing # entries, trigger xjob and configure security group rules for # instance port self._create_mapping_for_vm_port(t_ctx, res, pod) self._trigger_xjob_for_vm_port(context, res, pod) self.xjob_handler.configure_security_group_rules( t_ctx, res['tenant_id']) def _delete_shadow_bridge_port(self, t_ctx, bridge_port_id): mappings = db_api.get_bottom_mappings_by_top_id(t_ctx, bridge_port_id, t_constants.RT_SD_PORT) for pod, b_port_id in mappings: region_name = pod['region_name'] self._get_client(region_name).delete_ports(t_ctx, b_port_id) with t_ctx.session.begin(): core.delete_resources( t_ctx, models.ResourceRouting, filters=[{'key': 'top_id', 'comparator': 'eq', 'value': bridge_port_id}, {'key': 'pod_id', 'comparator': 'eq', 'value': pod['pod_id']}]) self._delete_shadow_bridge_port(t_ctx, t_ns_port_id)
deleted_lines: entries = [(ip['subnet_id'], t_constants.RT_SUBNET) for ip in res['fixed_ips']] entries.append((res['network_id'], t_constants.RT_NETWORK)) entries.append((res['id'], t_constants.RT_PORT)) if res['security_groups']: for sg_id in res['security_groups']: entries.append((sg_id, t_constants.RT_SG)) for resource_id, resource_type in entries: if db_api.get_bottom_id_by_top_id_region_name( t_ctx, resource_id, pod['region_name'], resource_type): continue db_api.create_resource_mapping(t_ctx, resource_id, resource_id, pod['pod_id'], res['tenant_id'], resource_type) interfaces = super(TricirclePlugin, self).get_ports( context, {'network_id': [res['network_id']], 'device_owner': [constants.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF]}) interfaces = [inf for inf in interfaces if inf['device_id']] if interfaces: # request may be come from service, we use an admin context # to run the xjob admin_context = t_context.get_admin_context() self.xjob_handler.setup_bottom_router( admin_context, res['network_id'], interfaces[0]['device_id'], pod['pod_id']) else: LOG.debug('Update port: no interfaces found, xjob not' 'triggered') self.xjob_handler.configure_security_group_rules(t_ctx, res['tenant_id'])

This change modifies the wait timeout for the
"/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save" to exist from 50 seconds to 15 seconds.

directory within 15 seconds I think it's safe to assume it will never be
created.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Change the wait timeout to be shorter

This change modifies the wait timeout for the
"/var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save" to exist from 50 seconds to 15 seconds.
This is being done because if the libvirt process does not create the
directory within 15 seconds I think it's safe to assume it will never be
created.

Change-Id: I270740cc98d56944fc425444a754bd61b365ce6b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Re-Add user defined environmental config

This change simply adds the ability for a user to load environment
configuration files from the /etc/openstack_deploy/env.d directory
which will override the system defined versions of these files. This
should allow us to define more robust scenario based testing or allow
an enduser to customize the container layout as they see fit.

Change-Id: I3b0f64769ba4b8cd62cba0a8d1fdea951a866776
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Cross-pod VxLAN network spec

1. What is the problem?
VLAN network has some restrictions that VxLAN network doesn't have.
For more flexible networking deployment, we consider supporting
cross-pod VxLAN network.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The detailed discussion of the proposals to support cross-pod VxLAN
network is covered in this specification.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
The proposed changes in this specification need to be implemented.

Change-Id: I79b41a63778660bd5a7b6e5e3d66ce0bd394e9af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/55/429155/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================================= Cross Pod VxLAN Networking in Tricircle ======================================= Background ========== Currently we only support VLAN as the cross-pod network type. For VLAN network type, central plugin in Tricircle picks a physical network and allocates a VLAN tag(or uses what users specify), then before the creation of local network, local plugin queries this provider network information and creates the network based on this information. Tricircle only guarantees that instance packets sent out of hosts in different pods but in the same VLAN network will be tagged with the same VLAN ID, deployers need to carefully configure physical networks and switch ports to make sure that packets can be transported correctly between physical devices. For more flexible deployment, VxLAN network type is a better choice. Instance packets are wrapped inside UDP packets so hosts in different pods only need to be IP routable to transport instance packets. It's indeed a need for Tricircle to support cross-pod VxLAN network. Proposal ======== There are some challenges to support cross-pod VxLAN network. Firstly, we need to keep VxLAN ID identical for the same VxLAN network across pods; secondly, we need to synchronize tunnel endpoint information between pods; thirdly, we need to trigger L2 agents to build tunnels based on this information. The first challenge is easy to solve, similar to VLAN network, we allocate VxLAN ID in central plugin and local plugin will use the same VxLAN ID to create local network. For the second challenge, we propose to introduce a new table called "shadow_agents" in Tricircle database, so central plugin can save the tunnel endpoint information collected from one local Neutron server in the database and populate the information to other local Neutron servers when needed. Here is the schema of the table: .. csv-table:: Shadow Agent Table :header: Field, Type, Nullable, Key, Default id, string, no, primary, null pod_id, string, no, unique, null host, string, no, unique, null type, string, no, , null tunnel_ip, string, no, , null **How to collect tunnel endpoint information** When the host where a port will be located is determined, local Neutron server will receive a port-update request containing host ID in the body. During the process of this request, local plugin can query agent information that contains tunnel endpoint information from local Neutron database with host ID and port VIF type; then send tunnel endpoint information to central Neutron server by issuing a port-update request with this information in the binding profile. **How to populate tunnel endpoint information** When the tunnel endpoint information in one pod is needed to be populated to other pods, XJob will issue port-create requests to corresponding local Neutron servers with tunnel endpoint information queried from Tricircle database in the bodies. After receiving such request, local Neutron server will save tunnel endpoint information by calling real core plugin's "create_or_update_agent" method. This method comes from neutron.db.agent_db.AgentDbMixin class. Plugins that support "agent" extension will have this method. Actually there's no such agent daemon running in the target local Neutron server, but we insert a record for it in the database so local Neutron server will consider there exists a agent, that's why we call it shadow agent. The proposed solution for the third challenge is based on the shadow agent and L2 population mechanism. In the original Neutron process, if the port status is updated to active, L2 population mechanism driver does two things. First, driver checks if the updated port is the first port in the target agent. If so, driver collects tunnel endpoint information of other ports in the same network, then send the information to the target agent via RPC. Second, driver sends the tunnel endpoint information of the updated port to other agents where ports in the same network are located, also via RPC. L2 agents will build the tunnels based on the information they received. To trigger the above processes to build tunnels across pods, we further introduce shadow port. Let's say we have two instance ports, port1 is located in host1 in pod1 and port2 is located in host2 in pod2. To make L2 agent running in host1 build a tunnel to host2, we create a port with the same properties of port2 in pod1. As discussed above, local Neutron server will create shadow agent during the process of port-create request, so local Neutron server in pod1 won't complain that host2 doesn't exist in pod1. To trigger L2 population process, we then update the port status to active, so L2 agent in host1 will receive tunnel endpoint information of port2 and build the tunnel. Port status is a read-only property so we can not directly update it via ReSTful API. Instead, we issue a port-update request with a special key in the binding profile. After local Neutron server receives such request, it pops the special key from the binding profile and updates the port status to active. XJob daemon will take the job to create and update shadow ports Here is the flow of shadow agent and shadow port process:: +-------+ +---------+ +---------+ | | | | +---------+ | | | Local | | Local | | | +----------+ +------+ | Local | | Nova | | Neutron | | Central | | | | | | Neutron | | Pod1 | | Pod1 | | Neutron | | Database | | XJob | | Pod2 | | | | | | | | | | | | | +---+---+ +---- ----+ +----+----+ +----+-----+ +--+---+ +----+----+ | | | | | | | update port1 | | | | | | [host id] | | | | | +---------------> | | | | | | update port1 | | | | | | [agent info] | | | | | +----------------> | | | | | | save shadow | | | | | | agent info | | | | | +----------------> | | | | | | | | | | | trigger shadow | | | | | | port setup job | | | | | | for pod1 | | | | | +---------------------------------> | | | | | | query ports in | | | | | | the same network | | | | | +------------------> | | | | | | | | | | | return port2 | | | | | <------------------+ | | | | query shadow | | | | | | agent info | | | | | | for port2 | | | | | <----------------+ | | | | | | | | | | | create shadow | | | | | | port for port2 | | | <--------------------------------------------------+ | | | | | | | | | create shadow | | | | | | agent and port | | | | | +-----+ | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | <-----+ | | | | | | | | update shadow | | | | | | port to active | | | <--------------------------------------------------+ | | | | | | | | | L2 population | | | trigger shadow | | +-----+ | | | port setup job | | | | | | | for pod2 | | | | | | +-----+ | | <-----+ | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | <-----+ | | | | | | | | | | | | | + + + + + + Bridge network can support VxLAN network in the same way, we just create shadow ports for router interface and router gateway. Different from instance port, it's L3 agent but not local Nova server who updates port with host ID and starts the whole process flow. Data Model Impact ================= New table "shadow_agents" is added. Dependencies ============ None Documentation Impact ==================== - Update configuration guide to introduce options for VxLAN network - Update networking guide to discuss new scenarios with VxLAN network References ========== None

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines,
user should import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

commit_message:
API: Correcting status response codes

Because Rest-full API is using HTTP protocol so it has to follow HTTP
status code [1]. For "error response codes", it must have status code
4xx not 203 [2].

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_status_codes
[2] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_status_codes#4xx_Client_Error

Change-Id: I2adb5a7720403ce3c6698401ffaadc932ffe9af9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/98/422998/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

want to configure Heat polling and signaling over the public endpoints
instead of the internal endpoints. In order to do so, endpoints for the

commit_message:
Create Heat API CFN endpoint

Create the Heat API CFN endpoint by including the needed puppet class.
Previously, we were not creating the endpoint.

When using deployed servers where the ctlplane is not routable, you may
want to configure Heat polling and signaling over the public endpoints
instead of the internal endpoints. In order to do so, endpoints for the
CFN service need to be created.

Change-Id: Iefa9d5bd3b03eb4812f24be2ca1ad0fa3a157402
Closes-Bug: #1674827
(cherry picked from commit 42d050ae3b3ec6186fd3f2f1e517b5861f16c23a)

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I71577f958f1ec075a4c8990c039f9a2e2db8a5ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.middleware refs/changes/34/448334/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I23995d56f04550391437cb0f131f37fccf5a2ebc

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of the
_LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to avoid
confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I471d79a86d88e98688246ffbdc29fb579f5fd52a

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems with dict.items

According to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3,
now we should avoid using six.iteritems and replace
it with dict.items.

There are still some left in cinder drivers.
So they should be fixed.

Change-Id: I70437f588dfc4b0da5f13c1b8bc2a3ff2f7b52bb
Closes-Bug: #1677141

commit_message:
serializer: remove deprecated RequestContextSerializer

We deprecated RequestContextSerializer in 404bebcca and
it's not used by any project, so we can remove it safely now.

Change-Id: I0300f5d2aaa85d515c0437e0e69399b9f5bad09a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/90/447390/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: __all__ = ['Serializer', 'NoOpSerializer', 'JsonPayloadSerializer', 'RequestContextSerializer']from debtcollector import removals from oslo_context import context as common_context@removals.removed_class("RequestContextSerializer", version="4.6", removal_version="5.0") class RequestContextSerializer(Serializer): def __init__(self, base): self._base = base def serialize_entity(self, context, entity): if not self._base: return entity return self._base.serialize_entity(context, entity) def deserialize_entity(self, context, entity): if not self._base: return entity return self._base.deserialize_entity(context, entity) def serialize_context(self, context): return context.to_dict() def deserialize_context(self, context): return common_context.RequestContext.from_dict(context)

commit_message:
Add bare parameter to get/list/search server

The bare parameter tells shade to skip all additional calls it makes to
fill in extra information on the server record from other services, such
as fixing the addresses dict. This is useful internally in shade where
there are times when one is getting the server dict just to get its id
so other operations, such as getting the console log or attaching
security groups, can be performed.

Change-Id: Ic9cc6e8be4f4e30f76d3abb655d9a3cf0cb9918b

commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq detection

rabbitmq was being detected incorrectly and was creating process
checks on hosts it didn't exist on.

commit_message:
Use Sphinx 1.5 warning-is-error

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, the setting for treat sphinx warnings as
errors is setting warning-is-error in build_sphinx section. Migrate
the setting from the old warnerrors one.

There are a number of issues that need to resolved to make this work.
Most of these trivial enough but unfortunately the history document
contains issue due to its inclusion of ChangeLog, which is based on
commit message summary lines and contains some invalid rST.  There
doesn't appear to be anyway to edit there retroactively nor disable
warnings on a specific files, thus the removal.

Change-Id: Ied79fc95d3711f8f3880e3e07e20f2c69b9a36ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/89/446589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
doc: add some documentation around quotas

There are always some questions about how quotas work
in Nova, particularly how they are checked against
the configuration vs the 'default' quota class in the
database, and global vs project-specific quotas.

This change starts a document on quotas a high-level.
It does not get into the lower-level details of how
quotas work or are designed in Nova, or the issues
that can arise with the existing quota system or future
plans.

Change-Id: Iabe3d40f44c59f14fa89ceddc556497d2885845c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/417563/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. ======== Quotas ======== Nova uses a quota system for setting limits on resources such as number of instances or amount of CPU that a specific project or user can use. Quotas are enforced by making a claim, or reservation, on resources when a request is made, such as creating a new server. If the claim fails, the request is rejected. If the reservation succeeds then the operation progresses until such a point that the reservation is either converted into usage (the operation was successful) or rolled back (the operation failed). Typically the quota reservation is made in the nova-api service and the usage or rollback is performed in the nova-compute service, at least when dealing with a server creation or move operation. Quota limits and usage can be retrieved via the ``limits`` REST API. Checking quota ============== When calculating limits for a given resource and tenant, the following checks are made in order: * Depending on the resource, is there a tenant-specific limit on the resource in either the `quotas` or `project_user_quotas` tables in the database? If so, use that as the limit. You can create these resources by doing:: nova quota-update --instances 5 <tenant_id> * Check to see if there is a hard limit for the given resource in the `quota_classes` table in the database for the `default` quota class. If so, use that as the limit. You can modify the default quota limit for a resource by doing:: nova quota-class-update --instances 5 default * If the above does not provide a resource limit, then rely on the ``quota_*`` configuration options for the default limit. .. note:: Once a default limit is set via the `default` quota class via the API which sets the limit in the quota_classes table, that takes precedence over any changes to that resource limit in the configuration options. In other words, once you've changed things via the API, you either have to keep those synchronized with the configuration values or remove the default limit from the database manually as there is no REST API for removing quota class values from the database.

commit_message:
Enable Kernel Samepage Merging by default

In an effort to reduce memory consumption enable KSM by default. The
biggest win here is when using libvirt with nova or ironic with its
fake baremetal instances. In theory any process that runs duplicates
with mergeable memory will benefit though.

Change-Id: I4c5addfd3e83b6516023b36cbaabd5169f0d5ceb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/19/447119/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Enable ksm as libvirt drivers should be able to take advantage of # sharedpage merging. if [[ -f /sys/kernel/mm/ksm/run ]] ; then sudo sh -c "echo 1 > /sys/kernel/mm/ksm/run" fi

commit_message:
Remove explicit log file for panko

This is causing selinux issues as the context
for apache doesnt match. Let apache create
app.log by default instead.

Change-Id: I670c88f6b1bcfcb5d5d6e14ad8e1ab936b417460
(cherry picked from commit 5db76aae39b4a66353e4a208d706d2ca12f7409f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-panko refs/changes/37/451537/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - Remove explcit panko.log file as this messes up the selinux context. When apache writes to it it complains. Instead let apache create the app.log on its own so the context are correct.

commit_message:
Add jmespath

jmespath is a python library implementing JMESPath
(http://jmespath.org/) which is a query language for JSON. shade added
JMESPath filter support inspired by a similar filter in Ansible. Ansible
already has a dependency on jmespath, so it's not a particularly onerous
new requirement in the OpenStack ecosystem generally.

It's also with noting that Amazon supports JMESPath expressions in their
CLI tool and in several of their SDKs.

- Is the library actively maintained?

Yes. It's been around for quite a while now and made its most recent
release 18 days ago. It also seems to be maintained by Amazon.

- Is the library good code?

Yes. It has good test coverage and has CI, and it works quite well.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

Yes, it is MIT licensed.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes, in ubuntu since Trusty, in Fedora since at least F23.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

No, it's not.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

shade allows users to filter returned lists of objects via jmespath
expressions.

Change-Id: I963a558f5e294521ad7b067ae95cc02d379cf73b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/08/451308/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add munch

munch is a lightweight library and is what shade returns from its
API instead of dicts of custom objects. In order for shade to sync
with global-requirements now that it's in the tent, we need to add them.

- Is the library actively maintained?

Yes. munch itself is a fork of bunch, which was not maintained. The most
recent release was made 9 days ago, and it has been in use in shade
with good results since Oct 19, 2015.

- Is the library good code?

Yes. It does everything one wants, and nothing one doesn't want.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

Yes, it is MIT licensed.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes, in ubuntu since Xenial, in Fedora since at least F22.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

No, it's not.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

Shade uses munch objects as part of its public API.

Change-Id: I4dd6be7a31d16a430c48ed4738fac4769c65975a

commit_message:
Set REVIEW_RELEASE to empty string by default

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/443216/ sets REVIEW_RELEASE
to STABLE_RELEASE when unset. This breaks the delorean builds
in upgrade jobs from reviews in master branch, where STABLE_RELEASE
is set to ocata and REVIEW_RELEASE needs to stay empty, wich implies
master branch.

Closes-Bug: #1677062

Change-Id: Ib70130e81fd10907cbba666c7daa86491a8a3eed

commit_message:
Disable designate in shade's gate jobs

The designate devstack jobs are broken in multiple ways. I have a patch
that fixes two of them, but there is also something about eventlet
versions. So for now, just turn it off - we still have the unit tests.
Once designate's devstack jobs are green again, we can re-enable.

Change-Id: I4eec135f59b30287bb0acb8ad27b1862b3f99a58
